intro: Piptocarpha regnellii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble small daisies. The plant produces narrow, linear leaves and has a robust root system adapted to survive in dry environments. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in desert scrub and grassland habitats. Piptocarpha regnellii is valued for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators.
